HwNcd-30GMueQaRcGK720Q.text: By far Best fish and chips I've had in London. Fish was extremely fresh, blend of flavors was tasty but not too saucy. Got the calamari on the side which I really enjoyed and was cooked very well. Also, the restaurant was extremely clean and service was great.

5GJADzNjuSTIjdTssTodxA.text: Something for everyone! I had the veg and it was spectacular. My sister (picky eater) had the panko chicken. Cousin had the lemon and basil tempura. Definitely would recommend! Everything was delicious

fsZQn63t4r8-NPmpA6pK6A.text: Oh boy oh boy best fish and chips I ever had yes!!! Amazing, it's definitely a must. Yes came all rhe way from Canada and very happy Yelp help me found this place. And the peeps working their are simply great! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Jamaican Jerk Fish and Chips

mv7W0mPn4xkQMw92HKoWRQ.text: fish and chips as it should be, fresh and crispy. Great selection of sauces and side to o with them. the slaw is particularly good. would recommend this place and I you're in Brussels or Antwep they have sister restaurant called Bia Mara in both cities

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. curried monkfish cheeks. bloody nice!!
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

bFWPQibwuPxRY3J-mKeE3w.text: This place is friggen good. Goes above and beyond your standard fish & chips joint. Menu items like Jamaican Jerk, Cajun Spiced and Mexican Spiced fish & chips set the bar pretty high here. It's also an appropriate amount of fish and chips. I'm a 6 foot tall, 30 year old male who weighs 187 pounds and it was the perfect amount of fish. Not too much like some places where you'll never finish it, and not too little where you're gonna leave less than satisfied. I'm am leaving here satisfied. I would eat here again."Guys, I'm gonna get a bubble tea before they close. It's right across the street."-Maya

FbpJYa5wJBpDMbIgZMQOrA.text: I have been here thrice. The fish is always fresh, perfectly fried, and the chips are seasoned with a special salt and very generous. Although some might call them wedges instead of chips!Panko wins hands down, by the way. While it seems like normal breadcrumbs, panko is literally "breadcrumbs" in Japanese. It's shredded in a spikier shape so it is crunchier and craggier, so it holds on to more of the seasoning. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but my favourites are:Cajun Spiced Panko Haddock with Seaweed Salted Chips & Lemon Cajun SauceJamaican Jerk Panko Haddock with Seaweed Salted Chips & Chipotle SauceGarlic and truffle mayonnaise is not to be missed. Silky with the aftertaste of truffle clinging on to your tastebuds.Since my last visit there has been chicken on the menu, which I have yet to try. I appreciate that there's a vegetarian option and it is now clearly indicated - when I last came I saw that on the menu and thought it was rather steep because I thought it was a side dish.If I had anything to pick on it would be the lack of choice regarding the chips. They are very good potatoes but somewhat idiosyncratic. I would like to have more choices of chips, such as sweet potato, courgette or regular old yellow chips - it does get a little monotonous when ordering. Since Hook does frying so beautifully I hope they expand the types of chips on the menu.If there were tempura prawns or some proper scampi, perhaps on a seasonal menu, I would be very pleased to return. One of the things about Hook is that I want new reasons to return, and I hope the quality of the kitchen will hold up to the whims of intrepid guests.

CNh8NhmyRemVxUy7uhKZ9g.text: Amazing and innovative fish and chips with the usual classics and new takes on fish and chips. The fish is fresh and the ingredients were high quality. They had a nice selection of Belgian beers too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

922rvEcV1GI7BStmMMt6tg.text: I was seriously impressed after my visit to Hook. Extremely reasonable prices- fancy fish and chips for £10! I tried the jerk panko haddock and it was cooked to perfection. The selection of sauces are great too! Very unpretentious and relaxed atmosphere and great tunes! I'll defo be back.

FTOaTd1mDa13Bkfdtw0TYg.text: Regular panko breaded fish chips, not too greasy and well portioned. The chips are homemade, nicely done. We had the seaweed salad, which was okay at best. I could see though how someone might love it, and many others would not like it at all. I'm in the middle. I will say my friend found 3 small bones in her fish, so eat with caution!

1f2uKxwwSVARuB4-rPS7Iw.text: We ate here three days in a row and the food and service was great each day. Love the consistency!  My favorite was the classic panko. Tried the garlic tempura but didn't really like the garlic dipping sauce. I prefer their home made tartar sauce, it's very tasty. Loved the chips cooked to perfection each day. Highly recommend this place!

gZeWm7O3k_cSOU_RYGqpSg.text: I ordered chicken n chips with butter garlic sauce. The chips is the best chips in fish n chips! Definitely worth a try! Gonna to try fish n chips next time^^ The surrounding is good too.

NsjVjzNR5Ex8OmywbgMYLA.text: Best fish and chips I can remember having. Great flavor and texture. Prices are very reasonable. Our waitress was incredibly nice and attentive. We ate so much around 1pm we didn't have room for dinner. If you haven't put this in your mouth, you've been living your life wrong.

iLpj74WwcjSyrCWApKz1hw.text: Delicious fish and flavored lemonade and the service was fabulous and friendly. The Camden area was a bit...gritty, but the fish and chips was worth it.

yXmwPyY-UV5wodz_eEP5gQ.text: Not a very selective menu. Good original fish and chips but not too much to choose from. Service was good. Definite place to go for fish and chips. Located in a very artsy area, Camden road. Fish is fresh from the market everyday so menu items are subject to change. Good food English food in a trendy and artsy area. Would recommend for a casual dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

oU1U3lm1124XJHaG4S0dPw.text: Fish day at Hook Camden. Recommended by many famous bloggers as I has wanted food in Camden which is sometimes a bit ponderous.The venue is bigger than you think but the main space to left and right near Windows is more airy and light than the back bit. Not the most definitive decor or identity if I'm truthful. Not much to give a story about themselves. Though I like sometimes like the idea of it being less 'selly'.Fish ranges from cod, haddock, pollock and coley. Haddock is a particular fav of mine and I know coley to be not the most favoured fish.I choose Hand cut chips, mint mushy peas with Argentinian Panko & chimichurri sauce. Portion is bigger than you realise upon arrival (and delving deep into it all).They do need bigger boxes which act as your plates as it is a bit cramped and the paper tears underneath and it is tough to grab flakey fish with a fork thereafter.Chips or wedge I'd say are a clear winner. Handcut and plenty of them. The minty mushy peas (each got one as a side) are not as flavoursome as I would have hoped. Prefer just a standard chip shop or out of tin mushy peas.I like that the fish is sustainable and that it is all not greasy at all. So much different and cleaner feel than going to a chip shop. The fish I had was good. Very light. I think this is all because of the Panko batter. Or breadcrumb if you will. It's much healthier and much lighter thus its emphasis is on the fish itself. The Panko adds a little texture and flavour. It was interesting to see fish being flavoured with breadcrumbs and I applaude this type of thinking for something deemed conventional.My Argentinian sauce was by far the best one we tried. Others good but this one stood out. My friends liked their fish of classic and Ethiopian. The sauces really added purpose and flavour as a side to the dish so impressed by these sauces esp the Argentinian one.It's defo one to go check for yourself. I myself will come back and try the flavoured tempura fish versions I think which use sea bream and see how different they are.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

B1OZKu56lgTPh1MUOLRfIg.text: I was disappointed not to be able to choose the coating for my cod.  It was set and they didn't want to do mix & match.The portion was on the samll side and the fish made the chips soggy.  Chips were too salty and greasy - they really needed to improve on this.  Cod was thin and not substanatial.  I don't think they offer a good value.

vtsmb0Jc-Ub1RUVcTIf3tA.text: In my opinion, they serve the best fish n chips in London! My wife and I enjoyed the selection of different fish n chips along with different sauces. I ordered the panko crusted fish n chip and it was "Ono", "Good" in Hawaiian. The price point was not bad and the service was good. I would definitely recommend anyone to come here if you are looking for a great fish n chips place to try while you are in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Panko crusted fish n chip (top) and lemon & basil fish n chip (bottom)

qgyQFyy7-hIM2hWpCZkSDQ.text: Always good. Friendly staff. Delicious takes on the traditional. Good veggie options too. Go for a stroll up Primrose Hill afterwards to work off some of this fried yum.

Dpn8q5S9mzWczsnB-MCqvA.text: Best fish and chips I've had in London! Get the lemon basil battered, you won't be sorry! The calamari is amazing too. They use all fresh seafood (not frozen), and vegetable oil for frying. Prices are very reasonable too. Friendly staff were patient in answering menu questions. I'll definitely be back and will refer friends here.

9aO02XAYn5mabL95so_1pQ.text: Woah. I'm totally hooked.(see what I did there?)This is the best fish and chips in London. Seriously, it is sooo good.You can choose traditional fish and chips OR go with some of their gorgeous sounding (and super tasty) more original flavours. Both fish were good naked, but were *amazing* once you add their sauces. We chose one panko, and one tempura:- Lemon & Fennel Panko Hake with Seaweed Salted Chips & Lemon & Basil Sauce (£10)- Lime, Mint & Wasabi Tempura of Seabream with Seaweed Salted Chips & Basil Chilli Sauce (£12)* We both liked the tempura version more than the panko (it wasn't really panko...it was just normal breadcrumbs - I guess they want to sound more posh!?)* The chips were sooo good. I love using nori for seasoning...and there were so many that it is impossible to finish a whole portion.* They use lots of different types of sustainable fish - so you can keep trying now types and discover that you love them ALL!* I looooved their sauces.* The home-made lemonade was delicious too (I tried lime and mint)I'll definitely go back, and you should go and try it too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. I can't remember this fish (possibly hake!?) with panko and cajun spices
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Whiting in tempura - sooo juicy and gooood.
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Nom nom noms...

whn-zPL1AFvq9-wAXwWvqA.text: The food is edible - but if you're looking for proper British fish & chips, look elsewhere.Given that chips are essentially what most fish and chip shops (chippies) are ranked on, I'm really confused why Hook went down the route of a strange oven baked, wedge-chip hybrid. Sure, they tasted fairly healthy, but they lacked substance and were 100x less satisfying than your standard chip shop chip.On to the fish. Their "classic" fish is coated in a panko breadcrumb crust, not batter. End result - dry fish.Lastly. I don't usually comment on condiments, but their ketchup is utterly bizarre. I don't know if they made this themselves, but it was not good. An overly sweet, runny, tomato concoction. Just stick to HeinzI'll emphasise again, this is far from an authentic British fish and chip shop. There are hundreds in London, take your pick.

KBsjrqVjw6Xl-AJFuNIQVQ.text: Best fish and chips in LondonBy far my favorite restaurants in London. Basil and Lemon fish with truffle sauce, amazing flavour and the chips go great with the truffle sauce.Calamari with the spicy squid sauce can't be missed tooUnfltd lager was also my favorite beer from London. Must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

hXGP_5tn1y6h2b5dJ-k8xg.text: A must if you are staying in London for a few days.One of the best, if not the best fish & chip I have had in years.The restaurant is situated very near Camden's main street, making it perfect for a pre-bar hoping night out (or even post-bar hoping).The service was warm and welcoming.

thv_xHzYL-35Pqw2oEChoA.text: My husband and I went there after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, & Dives. There are different choices for the batter and depending on which batter you choose, you will get cod or haddock. The lemon batter sounded good, so I got cod. My husband chose a spicy batter and got haddock. I'm not sure why, but my lemon battered cod was very greasy and so was the chips. I tried my husband's haddock and it tasted very good.  His chips were not greasy, either.  The minty mushy peas were underwhelming. Maybe there was too much mint in them. The service was very friendly. I'm not sure if I'd make the effort to go back, though.

04kmm8eLAJXwImn0GA-jyQ.text: The best fish and chips I had in London. Ever.What more to say...: God service, patient, smiling, fun and engaged. We ended up having a bit of a chat about places to visit when in Copenhagen and vice versa when in London.Really good food. Really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

rNSH4G6mPYlg0Bb3BCtPDw.text: I saw this place on Triple D and knew I had to try it when I came to London. This was pretty easy to get to from the Underground tube station, only about a 7 minute walk. When I walked in, I was greeted and the worker told me I could sit wherever I liked. Once I was seated, my server came over with a menu and I waked for her beer recommendation. I ordered the lemon basil tempura fish with chips, which with a garlic aioli and mushy peas. The fish and chips were amazing. The fish was battered perfectly and I could taste the basil and lemon and was flaky. The chips were hand cut in half circles and the garlic aioli to dip it in was awesome. The mushy peas weren't my favorite. They had a mint flavor to them, which I thought I would like, but I didn't, but it was ok because the fish and chips were great. The décor inside was industrial, but hip and there was plenty of seating. The service was friendly and attentive. This is definitely a place I recommend for fish and chips in London and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Drink menu
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Wild Goose Chase beer
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Drink menu

NbBNXnbem9CHAmA962mEHA.text: The fish was good not traidtional battered I thnk they did panko, the chips were not great, more like home fires...not crispy, baby likes crispy.

3cZp3flQdUYG7vDq5_WlMw.text: Really good chips. I mean *really* good, as in considering seconds and then realising you're too full.The fish is point on as well and it's probably better to try the more adventurous menu items to spice things up.The only downside is that they only have bottled beer, which I dislike, craft or no.

YARwWkW35uE2koMzA240gA.text: I was really excited to try Hook as it brings fresh touch to fish and chips. However, I left the restaurant quite disappointed. Not "hooked" at all...I found the menu and the sides quite limited. They only serve fried fish, no seafood.  Ordered Mexican spiced panko seabream with jalapeno and lime sauce, sumac & lemon tempura of seabream with baharat (what means spice in Turkish I do not know if it does make sense describing the ingredient  any other languages) sauce, Cajun spiced panko chicken what are served in little wooden boxes. I like the serving idea. Unfortunately, the fish was weak and portion size was not great. The fish were placed over the chips so the chips below were soggy. The chips actually were not chips, oily potato wedges. Moreover, it was slightly over seasoned with salt and pepper. Overall, I did not enjoy the chips. Salt and herbs overpowered. Only the chicken was nicely cooked.Atmosphere was nice; they have also party room which is a good option for big groups. Staff was helpful and attentive.I do not understand that the restaurant was listed in local cheap eats. They charge in breadcrumbs £10 and in tempura £12 for small fishes. It is not that cheap I assume in comparison with what you get.Overall, I respect the idea but new school fish and chips is not my cup of tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Mexican spiced panco sea bream

50jrFDTTHRXmEFcHsgjEaw.text: Stunning fish and chips for only £10. Panko breadcrumbed haddock with lemon and basil sauce accompanied by proper chips!The restaurant has a very cool vibe and I loved the benched seating. Busy for a Friday afternoon but service was very friendly and fast. The food was delicious. Crispy coated fish with an interesting tangy sauce. Would have loved to have tried the jerk ling but I was completely stuffed after my haddock. Definitely worth the walk from Camden Market to find this place, will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Haddock with proper chips
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Haddock

mKn7n-DXsRKGwcjcSnAjjg.text: Great take on the classic fish and chips. Fairly expensive for what it is but the quality makes it worth it!

4kN3RA7bn3C5CelnpM_j4w.text: 10/10Coming from someone who lives in a town who prides themselves on having the best seafood, I'd put this above many places at home. Great meal, huge portions, and great selections ! The staff was amazing and friendly. Also had some great suggestions for a wandering tourist.Make this a must-stop if you're ever around Camden !

LQ4auhBL8y0hR3XovgE_EA.text: Fantastic resturaunt in the heart of Camden serving their own twist on the classic fish and chips. The chips were perfect and well seasoned. I had the plains version of fish and chips covered in Panko breadcrumbs. They offered 5 different more modern twists such as bbq and other unique flavors. The portions were generous but not over-facing. The fish was fried to perfection and the service was friendly and attentive.

Dn3vTuBNem-Co1XoYeIlCA.text: Finally a decent FnC in my local area!!!!There are a few others that are ok, but this place really impressed me, I love the different flavours they have used for the fish and the selection that they have, I'm not an eco warrior but I thought that the sustainable fish idea was in tune with the local area (whole foods and organic green grocers down the street) the chips were crunchy and well seasoned, more importantly they aren't mean with the servings of chips either (my pet hate) The bar menu is really cool, a decent selection of ales and largess which include local breweries such as Camden Hells (very good!) The restaurants has a decent amount of seats, and take away option is available.More importantly the price is really affordable!! Under a £tenner each which you can't argue with in this part of town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Fishy goodness

dSV7FxbqSFYgS3rslBZ7rA.text: Great fusion fish and chips. Found this place on a whim and decided to try it because of the great Yelp rating. I loved the curry dip that came with the meal and the chips were addictive. The fish was great as well. You can tell it wasn't the typical cod or haddock that is used for traditional fish and chips but, it was a light tasting fish and was panko breaded (as opposed to battered) which was a nice twist on the fish and chips we all are familiar with. I would definitely visit again when I'm in the Camden town area.

oRHz4zynpJeYQT0ceJdmfA.text: So I'm pretty disappointed in this place after being really excited to try it because of all the unique flavor choices.I think if you have obvious first time customers, and from the US mind you.. that you should mention that if they're ordering the fish & chips and it's not cod or haddockwhich all fish & chips tend to be just about anywhere in the World... . Please INFORM THEM. I ordered this lemon/basil fish & chips and it was not at all  good. They used a fish called Sea Bream I believe after reading the reviews. I felt so sorry for myself that I didn't read the reviews previous to ordering this. That's not my job though. It's the servers responsibility to tell me since it's not at all listed anywhere on the latest menu they're giving out. It was fishy, still had the skin attached which was gross to me because of the fishiness it was already giving. This in particular fish is NOT GOOD for frying. It soaked up way too much oil because of its more meaty texture that In my opinion is only good for grilling, baking, broiling or WHATEVER else in the World besides frying. I know this place is probably good because I watched the people next to me tearing the shit up out of their fish which from looking at it was Panko crusted nice & flaky. PROBABLY THE COD OR HADDOCK. They were nodding their heads and looking at each other like .. mm, good right?! Yeah thumbs up. Yum! Yum! Lol oh my god. Sigh.What a damn shame. Giving 2 stars because the fries were delicious and I liked sitting by the door on those comfortable booths people watching, but my fish really sucked and I came all the way on the tube from St John's Wood to Camden Town just to try this place. Thats 3 lines, 2 changes and 11 stops. #TUBEWORLDPROBLEMS

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Lemon/Basil Fish & Chips

oa6WQknouIn8pstTgEjsPg.text: As someone wise once told me, "You don't get fish 'n chips in a pub.  You get it at a dedicated fish 'n chips shop."  He continues to be right.  Hook was excellent.  Perfect crust on the fish.  And chips were flavored very well.  We also got the tuna steak.  Wow.  It was a definite highlight.  Just seared enough to bring out the sizzle from the tuna fat.

l2h49Az3hWrfXhF55ztDDQ.text: Amazing fish and chips. This was a great first meal for me in London. Absolutely approve!

067_g9-Mq9RRduDlZ-kLkw.text: I love that Hook promotes sustainable fishing but my classic panko and jerk seasoned fish and chips were just ok. Nothing to write home about or go out of my way next time to eat. Restaurant is cool and beer selection decent. But they need to add more depth to the batter for the fried fish, IMO.

u3ty1RK_HaYXjsgdRESwdA.text: I ordered the classic panko fish and chips and the calamari small plate to share. The fish and chips were tasty and fresh. Service was a little slow, but there were only two people serving a full room. Decor inside is cute and clean!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

QNiRuyMXOMhqyUEW_PZC9w.text: 90s alternative music. Fish & chips. Cocktails. Nice peeps. This tiny joint a few steps away from Camden station can make your day. Go.

8AZ_QhjXpnQf8ppfPJvJdg.text: Hook is awesome for so many reasons. Let me count the ways:1) They promote sustainable fishing.2) Their fish and chips are great.3) They have a great beer selection.4) Staff is friendly.5) They have vinegar in spray bottles.I had the tempura battered lemon/basil sea bream (aka porgy). Fried perfectly. Not too greasy. Big filet slices. Tons of fries.The decor of the place is also cool, and it's great for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Lemon basil seabream
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Menu

DK1AFKdDx7l9e4bzBwD3WQ.text: I had the classic panko fish and chips. It was one of the best meals I ever had. The chips were cooked to perfection with the optimal amounts and salt and oil. The tartar sauce dip took the experience to a whole new level. This is the first time I had fish and chips. So, I cannot compare it to other places. But, you will definitely like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Classic panko fish and chips

DUhiwrJyt5RV9Pu6uu3RZg.text: Delicious freshly made fish and chips. Portions are plenty too, and it's right by Camden Market if you want to walk around and burn those calories afterwards!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

VCzpH7PCnxeqs6NdDzc-ng.text: Good fish and chips although it wasn't all that authentic. The fish was breaded with panko and the chips were basically home fries.

zzAWF-UggbLdH-AMbMCl2w.text: Great version of fish n chips/ service with a smile. I had the Piri Piri with Lime, excellent recommendation by my waitress. I will be back for some fish n chips from Hook

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Piri Piri and Lime

3FaSn55FJfi_bG6PwcQUqQ.text: I got your basic panko breaded haddock with tartar sauce and chips. My husband got lemon basil fish with garlic truffle mayo, a side of calamari rings, a raspberry lemonade with vodka, and an Epic Saison. When the order came to the table (quickly, I might add) I thought there was no way we could finish it all - but we did. And it was ALL delish. Nice interior, cheerful service, decent prices for the portion sizes. My husband would pass on the beer, though - don't read the copy on the bottle!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. panko breaded and yummy

zjjcPNfKs5_iB5uMRCEQjw.text: The best fish and chips we had in England! We were exploring Camden Lock Market and decided to walk over here instead of eating the the market and are SO glad we did.The food is delicious, the service is good, and the prices are reasonable. We got the lemon and basil tempura fish and chips and the malaysian curry panko fish and chips. The fish was fresh and perfectly cooked and the chips were amazing. I love that they work with sustainable fisheries and tell you about the catches of the day.We will definitely be back. Thank you for a great meal!

RWqzTgbwnBSfuc-6RGnUMQ.text: Was staying close buy camden and wanted to try the classic fish and chips.  While not the traditional style, Hook did not dissapoint.  Ordered the jerk fish and chips with a mango sauce.  Jerk seasoning was very light and fish very flaky.  Would definately recommend this for a quick bite with no fuss.  Only thing missing was malt vinegar for the chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Jerk fish and chips

ehd79MF77O6wBvQYS-6AuA.text: This was a great first meal in London.  Hook has classic fish and chips that will serve as the metric by which all others in the city are measured.  However, their curry fish and chips is also amazing if you're feeling more adventurous.The service was top-notch.  The staff were genuinely friendly towards us, happy to offer their recommendations for what to see and do in the area.  They struck a nice balance between the relaxed European service style and the more attentive approach to which most Americans are likely to be accustomed.I also greatly appreciate and applaud that they support sustainable fishing.

GHJ8LI2A9gA3RUxpXNE_kw.text: We came to try this place after seeing it on Guy Fieri. Pretty good...their fish is fried with panko, but it's not overly thick batter. Their chips..for some reason is so addicting. They provide vinegar sprays? New concept for us, we're used to the bottles!

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom

qon0cFiSMmEHZbciPJ7N8g.text: Sunday afternoon lunch after a long walk in Regent's Park. Server was friendly and atmosphere was welcoming.We got the panko crusted haddock and was not disappointed. Light, fresh, flavourful. It was everything that new age fish and chips should be.Also got a side of mushy mint peas which was some of the best i ever had. Refreshing and great addition to the overall meal. Very good quality for the price and exceeded all expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Light, flavourful and delicious. Great fish and chips.

_--lGi96uS8Q6km98y9DSA.text: First meal in london. Good fish and chips, interesting flavors, nice place with good service. Worth the 2 mile round trip walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Cod basil garlic
Photo of Hook - Camden Town, London, United Kingdom. Hake truffle

vyArRew53rwgGLf-7l7VnA.text: "Oh my goodness! That was the best fish and chips I've ever had". Says everyone ever. I always do a little smile every time I bring friends, family, work colleagues here as they absolutely love it, but I mean who doesn't! I'm totally in love with Hook if you hadn't guessed. Not in a first love, its over before you know it novelty way but in a golden wedding anniversary way where I want to keep coming here every day for the rest of my life. Trust me, its that good.  The staff here are super friendly, they have a great craft beer selection too and are happy to talk about any new beers/breweries they are selling. In fact, I found my beloved Cloudwater brewery as the result of a recommendation through the team at Hook. I've met one of the owners too at Taste of London, what a nice chap. They're just a bunch of very down to earth, genuine, friendly/happy people and you definitely feel that when you arrive.  The food, well what can I say. Its not your usual fish and chips from your local chippy, it definitely has a twist to it but its good to try something a bit different every now and again. Whichever fish you try, whether that's the panko breadcrumbs style or tempura batter it will melt and flake in your mouth. Great flavours too from lemon and basil tempura style to Argentinan panko. Yum! The chips are different too, flat seaweed salty chips (you can't taste the sea honest) and the portions are always extremely generous. I'm a sauce fiend so the mix and match of 6 option is always a winner and you know what I hate more than anything...Calamari! I always have and always will BUT bizarrely I always eat it when I come here. Its so damn good! They must have slipped something in to my drink...or again it could just be the melt in your mouth taste. If you follow Hook on Instagram too you might see a cheeky 50% off offer on Mondays every now and again but I'm reluctantly telling you this as I'm worried that on my regular Monday club trips I won't get a seat but that's the beauty of Yelp I guess...sharing is caring!
